title: How to Make Woven Wheat Cereal Treats

steps.headline: Grab 20 wheat squares and put them on a large workspace.
steps.description: You will be making a bit of a mess so you need a lot of room.

steps.headline: Cut off one end of the wheat squares (take care not to break the wheat square).
steps.description: Hollow it out with a toothpick.

steps.headline: Using the same or a different toothpick, scoop up a little bit of the fruit spread and stuff it inside, making sure not to overfill it.
steps.description: If you overfill it the wheat square could break.

steps.headline: Put the filled squares on a good-sized plate.
steps.description: Sift powdered sugar over them until covered, as desired.

steps.headline: If using, take 10 blueberries and 10 raspberries.
steps.description: Place one on top of each wheat square. You can also do a different combination of fruit if wanted.

steps.headline: Get 4 giant wheat squares.
steps.description: Break off the ends and hollow them with your clean finger or a small spoon.

steps.headline: Put a small spoon of fruit filling inside.
steps.description: Don't add too much because you don't want it to be too sweet.

steps.headline: Get a spoon of powdered sugar and gently shake it onto the squares.
Put 3 blueberries on each square.
steps.description: (You can use another method if preferred.)

text: Using regular wheat squares Grab 20 wheat squares and put them on a large workspace. You will be making a bit of a mess so you need a lot of room. Cut off one end of the wheat squares (take care not to break the wheat square). Hollow it out with a toothpick. Using the same or a different toothpick, scoop up a little bit of the fruit spread and stuff it inside, making sure not to overfill it. If you overfill it the wheat square could break. Put the filled squares on a good-sized plate. Sift powdered sugar over them until covered, as desired. If using, take 10 blueberries and 10 raspberries. Place one on top of each wheat square. You can also do a different combination of fruit if wanted. Serve immediately.  Using giant wheat squares Get 4 giant wheat squares. Break off the ends and hollow them with your clean finger or a small spoon. Put a small spoon of fruit filling inside. Don't add too much because you don't want it to be too sweet. Get a spoon of powdered sugar and gently shake it onto the squares.  Put 3 blueberries on each square. (You can use another method if preferred.) Serve immediately.
